Award.AbstractNarration:
Title: Student Mentoring Workshop at International Conference on Functional Programming, 2016

A Student Mentoring Workshop is being organized as part of the 21st International Conference on Functional Programming (ICFP), one of the premier conferences in the area of programming languages. The conference will be held in Nara, Japan. This grant will support approximately 12 students to attend the mentoring workshop plus the ICFP conference. This proposal is intended specifically to target women students and students from underrepresented groups and gives priority to US citizens and permanent residents. The broader significance and importance of the grant relate to the need to broaden participation, provide opportunities for students to receive mentoring from leading members of the programming languages community, and build the next generation of researchers and knowledgeable practitioners in this important research arena.

POR.DRECONTENT:
PLMW is a series of day-long meetings held as prequels to various top programming languages research conferences. They aim to prepare students and other aspiring researchers both for the conference itself, but more generally for the life of a researcher.

In 2016, we held PLMW ahead of ICFP in Nara, Japan. We invited 10 speakers to cover a diverse range of topics and the money in this project supported 10 US-based students' travel, registration, and housing costs.

The meeting consisted of 10 talks by established researchers in programming languages, given a wide variety of topics. The speakers presented background material on types and operational semantics, cutting-edge research on JavaScript and program transformation, the path from a PhD to research career in industry, and talks about how to prepare research papers and give talks. In addition, the speakers and the attendees enjoyed a traditional Japanese dinner together giving time for the attendees to get to know the speakers and each other a little bit better.

The meeting was a success, with students reporting in the post-event questionnaire that "... it was amazing and the people I met, both peers and mentors, were truly inspiring." and "[i]t was overall a great experience and I well enjoyed it. I really appreciate all the ones who organized the workshop and all the presenters who gave the wonderful talks!"
